column4: help me please, i just installed ubuntu 10.04 and the sound worked with the live cd, but with my new install no sound. what can i do?
are you sure it's not muted?
well, how does lspci identify your sound device.. that would be a place to start
how do i do that?
open a terminal, and type "lspci" no quotes, and hit enter(thats a lowercase L)... look through the output, and find your sound device, don't paste your whole lspci here.
yeah.. hang on.. i've red about a problemw / that device.
open a terminal and type     alsamixer   hit enter... and see if any of those are muted
no only mic was muted i just raised them up
no dice
i've solved the problem w/ that device before, but it was a long time ago, and i'm trying to remember what the issue was
just curious, what kind of laptop do you have?
what kind of laptop is it?
this is a desktop. i just installed a new motherboard/cpu/ram
what version of ubuntu are you using again?
type this w/o quotes... "/join #km0201"  i think i found the answer, but it's fairly detailed....
greetings... get the sound problem figured out?
lol, sound cards are cheap.
hmm
does the machine have frontside audio hooked up?
ok...
this is me in livecd mode, and guess what? the sound is now busted here too.
hmm
